intro: Polygala corallicola, commonly known as the coral lichen polygala, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Polygalaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that often have a coral-like appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, and it produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
